Articles.Content:
Ok, let's be honest here, not many people actually play KSP2 right now. As I've seen it used, the KSP2 subforums are solely used for keeping up to date with the devs, and for bickering over the future of KSP2. A comparatively sparse amount of mission reports and challenges and craft sharing and mod discussion are going on in KSP2 compared to KSP1.

My suggestion is to move the KSP1 subforums physically above the KSP2 subforums like they used to be before the launch of KSP2. This has probably been suggested before, but I haven't found it yet (please let me know if it's been suggested and denied before). This doesn't have to be permanent, maybe just until the arguing simmers down, or until KSP2 gets a few more major updates.

This may seem like a minor change, but it will at least for me work to attract me more to the KSP1 subforums, so that my first thing I do when checking the forums is to see what cool stuff is happening in the KSP1 community, instead of read the endless arguing happening in the KSP2 subforums.
You can collapse the KSP2 sections, and then only pop them open occasionally when you want to check.
Sure, the best way to attract attention to a new product is to hide it behind an old product. 101 marketing, right?

13 hours ago, Geonovast said:

You can collapse the KSP2 sections, and then only pop them open occasionally when you want to check.

oh, I didn't know about that feature, thank you for letting me know about it!

3 minutes ago, The Aziz said:

Sure, the best way to attract attention to a new product is to hide it behind an old product. 101 marketing, right?

While I see your point, on a forum dedicated to the Kerbal Space Program community, I doubt you're going to detract many new buyers from KSP2 by moving the category. I feel like everyone who frequents the forums have already made up their decision about when/if they're buying the game. I just thought this organization would make a little more sense to more accurately match how activity is distributed on the forums and to help cool down the whole KSP2 situation
Having KSP2 on the top of the page is a deliberate placement and won’t be changed.
